Package org.yesworkflow.data

Class UriBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.yesworkflow.data.UriBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConcreteUri, UriTemplate

    public abstract class UriBase
extends Object

    This class represents the fields and methods shared between Uri and UriTemplate. All fields of a UriBase instance are final and immutable, and the class is thread safe.

    This file is derived from UriBase.java in the org.restflow.data package as of 28Apr2015.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  UriBase.SchemePathPair
      This class is used by extractSchemeAndPath() to return a pair of values, one representing the scheme portion of a URI, the other the path portion of the template.

        public static final String NO_SCHEME
        Value returned by getScheme() when no scheme is included in the full template.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • UriBase

        public UriBase​(String expression,
               boolean trimTerminalSlash)
        Initializes the core fields of a Uri or UriTemplate object. Extracts the scheme and path portions of the passed expression and optionally trims the terminal slash from the path.
        Parameters:
        expression - A string representation of the full URI or URI template to construct.
        trimTerminalSlash - True to remove the terminal slash of expression prior to further processing.

      • UriBase

        public UriBase​(String uriString)
        Initializes the core fields of a Uri or UriTemplate object. Extracts the scheme and path portions of the passed expression. Does not trim the terminal slash from the path.
        Parameters:
        uriString - A string representation of the full URI or URI template to construct.

    • Method Detail

      • getExpression

        public String getExpression​()
        Returns:
        The full URI represented by the instance.

      • getName

        public String getName​()
        Returns:
        The name portion of the URI.

      • getPath

        public String getPath​()
        Returns:
        The path portion of the URI.

      • getScheme

        public String getScheme​()
        Returns:
        The scheme portion of the URI if one is defined, otherwise NO_SCHEME

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the full URI.

      • extractPathName

        public static String extractPathName​(String path)
        Returns the portion of a path that follows the final slash, or the entire path if there is no slash. The empty string is returned if the path ends with a slash.
        Parameters:
        path - A path expression contanining zero or more slashes.
        Returns:
        The name (terminal text) portion of the path.

      • extractSchemeAndPath

        public static UriBase.SchemePathPair extractSchemeAndPath​(String uriString)
        Splits a URI string into scheme and path portions. Assumes that the first colon in the string delimits the scheme and path portion of the URI.
        Parameters:
        uriString - A string representation of a URI optionally including a scheme portion.
        Returns:
        A custom object comprising the scheme and path portions of a URI as two public fields.

      • trimTerminalSlash

        public static String trimTerminalSlash​(String uriString)
        Removes the terminal slash from a URI string if present. The slash is not removed if it comprises the entire path portion of the URI string.
        Parameters:
        uriString - A String representing a URI that may end with a slash.
        Returns:
        A string representing the input URI with terminal slash removed.

      • encodeString

        public static String encodeString​(String unescapedString)

      • extractParent

        public static String extractParent​(String path)
        Returns the scheme and path portion of uri, up to the final element.
        Parameters:
        path - A path expression contanining zero or more slashes.
        Returns:
        The parent portion of the path.
